00014 void Lgm_free_ctrans( Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
00015 
00016     
00017 
00018     free( c->l.LeapSecondDates );
00019     free( c->l.LeapSecondJDs );
00020     free( c->l.LeapSeconds );
00021 
00022     free(c);
00023 
00024 }

00027 Lgm_CTrans *Lgm_init_ctrans( int Verbose ) {
00028 
00029     Lgm_CTrans      *c;
00030    
00031     c = (Lgm_CTrans *) calloc (1, sizeof(*c));
00032     
00033     /*
00034      * Load Leap Seconds Stuff 
00035      */
00036     Lgm_LoadLeapSeconds( c );
00037 
00038 
00039 
00040     c->Verbose     = Verbose;
00041 
00042     /*
00043      * Set Number of Nutation series terms to 106
00044      */
00045     c->nNutationTerms = 106;
00046 
00047     /*
00048      *  Initialize Earth Orientation Parameters to defaults They can be
00049      *  over-ridden later with actual values.  This allows users to use the
00050      *  less accurate defaults if EOP data is unavailable or not
00051      *  needed/desired.
00052      */  
00053     c->DUT1  = 0.0; // seconds
00054     c->xp    = 0.0; // radians
00055     c->yp    = 0.0; // radians
00056     c->ddPsi = 0.0; // radians
00057     c->ddEps = 0.0; // radians
00058 
00059     return c;
00060 
00061 }

00068 Lgm_CTrans *Lgm_CopyCTrans( Lgm_CTrans *s ) {
00069 
00070     Lgm_CTrans *t;
00071     int         n;
00072 
00073 
00074     if ( s == NULL) {
00075         printf("Lgm_CopyCTrans: Error, source structure is NULL\n");
00076         return;
00077     }
00078 
00079     /*
00080      * Allocate memory for target
00081      */
00082     t = (Lgm_CTrans *)calloc( 1, sizeof(Lgm_CTrans) );
00083 
00084     /*
00085      * Do memcpy. Note that for things that are dynamically allocated in
00086      * Lgm_CTrans structure, this will copy pointers to to memory that belong
00087      * to the source. Currently, the LeapSecond stuff is dynamically allocated,
00088      * so we need to allocate our own memory for those and then do a memcpy on
00089      * the contents.
00090      */
00091     memcpy( t, s, sizeof(Lgm_CTrans) );
00092 
00093     /*
00094      *  Now, copy the LeapSeconds stuff properly (they were dyn. allocated). 
00095      *  (memcpy's args are (dest, src, size))
00096      */
00097     n = t->l.nLeapSecondDates = s->l.nLeapSecondDates;
00098     t->l.LeapSecondDates  = (long int *) malloc( n*sizeof(long int) );
00099     t->l.LeapSecondJDs    = (double *)   malloc( n*sizeof(double) );
00100     t->l.LeapSeconds      = (double *)   malloc( n*sizeof(double) );
00101     memcpy( t->l.LeapSecondDates, s->l.LeapSecondDates, n*sizeof(long int) );
00102     memcpy( t->l.LeapSecondJDs,   s->l.LeapSecondJDs, n*sizeof(double) );
00103     memcpy( t->l.LeapSeconds,     s->l.LeapSeconds, n*sizeof(double) );
00104 
00105     return( t );
00106 
00107 }

00114 void Lgm_Radec_to_Cart(double ra, double dec, Lgm_Vector *r) {
00115 
00116     double  CosDec;
00117 
00118 
00119     /*
00120      *  Convert ra/dec from degrees to radians
00121      */
00122     ra  *= RadPerDeg;
00123     dec *= RadPerDeg;
00124 
00125     CosDec = cos(dec);
00126 
00127     /*
00128      *  Compute cartesian coordinates (in GEI)
00129      */
00130     r->x = CosDec * cos(ra);
00131     r->y = CosDec * sin(ra);
00132     r->z = sin(dec);
00133 
00134 }

00136 double Lgm_angle2pi(double angle) {
00137 
00138     int n;
00139     double a = M_2PI;
00140 
00141     if (angle < 0.0){
00142         n = (int)(angle/a) - 1;
00143         return(angle-n*a);
00144     } else if (angle > a){
00145         n = (int)(angle/a);
00146         return(angle-n*a);
00147     } else{
00148         return(angle);
00149     }
00150 
00151 }
00152 
00153 double Lgm_angle360(double angle) {
00154 
00155     int n;
00156 
00157     if (angle < 0.0){
00158         n = (int)(angle/360.0) - 1;
00159         return(angle-n*360.0);
00160     } else if (angle > 360.0){
00161         n = (int)(angle/360.0);
00162         return(angle-n*360.0);
00163     } else{
00164         return(angle);
00165     }
00166 
00167 }

00175 long int Lgm_JD_to_Date(double jd, int *ny, int *nm, int *nd, double *UT) {
00176 
00177     long int    I, A, B, C, D, E, G, Date;
00178     double      F;
00179 
00180     jd += 0.5;
00181     
00182     I = (int)jd;
00183     F = jd - (double)I;
00184 
00185     if ( I > 2299160 ) {
00186         A = (int)( ((double)I - 1867216.25)/36524.25 );
00187         B = I+1+A-(int)( (double)A/4.0 );
00188     } else {
00189         B = I;
00190     }
00191 
00192     C = B+1524;
00193 
00194     D = (int)( ((double)C - 122.1)/365.25 );
00195     E = (int)( 365.25*D );
00196 
00197     G = (int)( ((double)C-(double)E)/30.6001 );
00198 
00199     /*
00200      *  Day of month 
00201      */
00202     *nd = C - E - (int)( 30.6001*G );
00203     *UT = 24.0*F;
00204 
00205     if ( G <= 13 ) {
00206         *nm = G-1;
00207     } else if ( G > 13 ) {
00208         *nm = G-13;
00209     }
00210 
00211     if ( *nm > 2 ) {
00212         *ny = D-4716;
00213     } else if ( *nm <= 2 ) {
00214         *ny = D-4715;
00215     }
00216 
00217     Date = *ny*10000 + *nm*100 + *nd;
00218 
00219     return( Date );
00220 
00221 }
00222 
00223 long int Lgm_MJD_to_Date(double mjd, int *ny, int *nm, int *nd, double *UT) {
00224     return( Lgm_JD_to_Date( mjd+2400000.5, ny, nm, nd, UT ) );
00225 }

00227 double Lgm_hour24(double hour) {
00228     int n;
00229 
00230     if (hour < 0.0){
00231         n = (int)(hour/24.0) - 1;
00232         return(hour-n*24.0);
00233     } else if (hour > 24.0){
00234         n = (int)(hour/24.0);
00235         return(hour-n*24.0);
00236     } else{
00237         return(hour);
00238     }
00239 }
00240 
00241 double Lgm_kepler(double M, double e) {
00242     int     n=0;
00243     double  E, Eold, eps = 1.0e-8;
00244 
00245     E = M + e*sin(M);
00246     do{
00247         Eold = E;
00248         E = Eold + (M-Eold+e*sin(Eold)) / (1.0-e*cos(Eold));
00249         ++n;
00250     } while( (fabs(E-Eold) > eps) && (n < 100) );
00251     return(E);
00252 }

00256 /*
00257  *  This routine takes date and time and sets up all the transformation
00258  *  matrices to do coord transformations.
00259  *
00260  *      Date    -- (long int)   containing date ( e.g. YYYYMMDD or YYYYDDD )
00261  *      UT      -- (double)     decimal UT in hours ( e.g. 12.0 is noon ).
00262  *      c       -- (Lgm_CTrans) structure containing releveant trans. data
00263  */
00264 void Lgm_Set_Coord_Transforms(long int date, double UTC, Lgm_CTrans *c) {
00265 
00266     int         year, month, day, doy;
00267     double      TU, gmst, gast, sn, cs, Time;
00268     double      varep, varpi, spsi;
00269     double      eccen, epsilon;
00270     double      days, M, E, nu, lambnew;
00271     double      r0, earth_sun_distance;
00272     double      RA, DEC, RA_Moon, DEC_Moon;
00273     double      gclat, glon, psi;
00274     double      Lmoon_0, P0, N0, Imoon, Lmoon, Mmoon_m, Nmoon, Cmoon;
00275     double      Emoon_nu, Amoon_e, Amoon_3, Mmoon_mp, Emoon_c, amoon, emoon;
00276     double      Amoon_4, Lmoon_p, Vmoon, Lmoon_pp, Nmoon_p, LambdaMoon, BetaMoon;
00277     double      g[13][13], h[13][13], Tmp[3][3];
00278     double      l, r, b;
00279     double      varep90, varpi90;
00280     double      Zeta, Theta, Zee;
00281     double      SinZee, CosZee, SinZeta, CosZeta, SinTheta, CosTheta;
00282     Lgm_Vector  S, K, Y, Z, D, Dmod, Dgsm, u_mod, u_tod, u_gei, Zgeo, X;
00283     double      RA_tod, DEC_tod;
00284     double      RA_gei, DEC_gei;
00285     double      sxp, cxp, syp, cyp;
00286     double      sdp, cdp, se, ce, set, cet;
00287     double      T_UT1, T2_UT1, T3_UT1, T_TT, T2_TT, T3_TT, T4_TT, T5_TT;
00288     double      cos_epsilon, sin_epsilon, sin_lambnew, sin_b, cos_b, sin_l, tmp;
00289     int         i, j, N;
00290 
00291 
00292     /*
00293      * Set UTC values
00294      */
00295     Lgm_Doy( date, &year, &month, &day, &doy);
00296     date          = year*10000+month*100+day;
00297     c->UTC.Date   = date;
00298     c->UTC.Time   = UTC;
00299     c->UTC.Year   = year;
00300     c->UTC.Month  = month;
00301     c->UTC.Day    = day;
00302     c->UTC.Doy    = doy;
00303     c->UTC.Dow    = Lgm_DayOfWeek( year, month, day, c->UTC.DowStr );
00304     c->UTC.JD     = Lgm_JD( c->UTC.Year, c->UTC.Month, c->UTC.Day, c->UTC.Time, LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC, c );
00305     c->UTC.T      = (c->UTC.JD - 2451545.0)/36525.0;
00306     c->UTC.fYear = (double)c->UTC.Year + ((double)c->UTC.Doy + c->UTC.Time/24.0)/(365.0 + (double)Lgm_LeapYear(c->UTC.Year));
00307 
00308     // set DAT
00309     c->DAT        = Lgm_GetLeapSeconds( c->UTC.JD, c ); 
00310 
00311 
00312 
00313 
00314     /*
00315      * Set UT1 values
00316      */
00317     c->UT1      = c->UTC; // initially make DateTime structures the same
00318     c->UT1.Time = c->UTC.Time + c->DUT1/3600.0;
00319     c->UT1.JD   = Lgm_JD( c->UT1.Year, c->UT1.Month, c->UT1.Day, c->UT1.Time, LGM_TIME_SYS_UT1, c );
00320     c->UT1.Date = Lgm_JD_to_Date( c->UT1.JD, &c->UT1.Year, &c->UT1.Month, &c->UT1.Day, &Time ); 
00321     c->UT1.Time = Lgm_hour24( c->UT1.Time ); // Keep the time we had rather than gettingm it back from Lgm_JD_to_Date(). This limits roundoff error
00322     c->UT1.T    = (c->UT1.JD - 2451545.0)/36525.0;
00323     T_UT1       = c->UT1.T;
00324     T2_UT1      = T_UT1*T_UT1;
00325     T3_UT1      = T_UT1*T2_UT1;
00326     
00327 
00328     /*
00329      * Set TAI values
00330      */
00331     c->TAI      = c->UTC; // initially make DateTime structures the same
00332     c->TAI.Time = c->UTC.Time + c->DAT/3600.0;
00333     c->TAI.JD   = Lgm_JD( c->TAI.Year, c->TAI.Month, c->TAI.Day, c->TAI.Time, LGM_TIME_SYS_TAI, c );
00334     c->TAI.Date = Lgm_JD_to_Date( c->TAI.JD, &c->TAI.Year, &c->TAI.Month, &c->TAI.Day, &Time );
00335     c->TAI.Time = Lgm_hour24( c->TAI.Time ); // Keep the time we had rather than gettingm it back from Lgm_JD_to_Date(). This limits roundoff error
00336     c->TAI.T    = (c->TAI.JD - 2451545.0)/36525.0;
00337     
00338 
00339     /*
00340      * Set TT values
00341      */
00342     c->TT       = c->TAI; // initially make DateTime structure the same as TAI
00343     c->TT.Time  = c->TAI.Time + 32.184/3600.0;
00344     c->TT.JD    = Lgm_JD( c->TT.Year, c->TT.Month, c->TT.Day, c->TT.Time, LGM_TIME_SYS_TT, c );
00345     c->TT.Date  = Lgm_JD_to_Date( c->TT.JD, &c->TT.Year, &c->TT.Month, &c->TT.Day, &Time );
00346     c->TT.Time  = Lgm_hour24( c->TT.Time ); // Keep the time we had rather than gettingm it back from Lgm_JD_to_Date(). This limits roundoff error
00347     c->TT.T     = (c->TT.JD - 2451545.0)/36525.0;
00348     T_TT        = c->TT.T;
00349     T2_TT       = T_TT*T_TT;
00350     T3_TT       = T_TT*T2_TT;
00351     T4_TT       = T2_TT*T2_TT;
00352     T5_TT       = T3_TT*T2_TT;
00353 
00354 
00355 
00356     Lgm_TT_to_TDB( &c->TT, &c->TDB, c );
00357 
00358 
00359 
00360     /* 
00361      *  Compute Greenwich Mean Sidereal Time (gmst)
00362      *  T0 = number of Julian centuries since 2000 January 1.5 to 0h on the date we are interested in.
00363      *  T  = number of Julian centuries since 2000 January 1.5 to the UT on the date we are interested in.
00364      *  (See Astronomical Almanac or e.g. Vallado.)
00365      */
00366     c->gmst = fmod( (67310.54841 + (876600.0*3600.0 + 8640184.812866)*T_UT1  + 0.093104*T2_UT1 - 6.2e-6*T3_UT1)/3600.0, 24.0);
00367     gmst    = c->gmst*15.0*RadPerDeg; // convert to radians for ease later on
00368     
00369     
00370 
00371 
00372 
00373 
00374 
00375 
00376     /*
00377      *
00378      *   Construct Transformation Matrix from MOD to GSE  systems
00379      *
00380      * 
00381      *   First compute:
00382      *          mean ecliptic longitude of sun at epoch TU (varep)
00383      *          elciptic longitude of perigee at epoch TU (varpi)
00384      *          eccentricity of orbit at epoch TU (eccen)
00385      *
00386      *   The TU here is the number of Julian centuries since
00387      *   1900 January 0.0 (= 2415020.0)
00388      */
00389 //    TDT   = Lgm_UTC_to_TT( c->JD, UT );
00390 //    c->TT = TDT;
00391 //UPDATE THIS TO IAU-76/FK-5
00392     TU    = ( Lgm_JD( c->TT.Year,  c->TT.Month,  c->TT.Day, c->TT.Time, LGM_TIME_SYS_TT, c) - 2415020.0 )/36525.0;
00393     varep = (279.6966778 + 36000.76892*TU + 0.0003025*TU*TU)*RadPerDeg;
00394     varpi = (281.2208444 + 1.719175*TU + 0.000452778*TU*TU)*RadPerDeg;
00395     eccen = 0.01675104 - 0.0000418*TU - 0.000000126*TU*TU;
00396     c->eccentricity = eccen;
00397 
00398 
00399 
00400     /*
00401      *  Compute the Obliquity of the Ecliptic at epoch TU
00402      *  The TU in this formula is the number of Julian
00403      *  centuries since epoch 2000 January 1.5
00404      */
00405     //epsilon    = (84381.448 - 46.8150*T_TT - 0.00059*T2_TT + 0.001813*T3_TT)*RadPerDeg/3600.0; // IAU-76/FK5 value
00406     c->epsilon    = 84381.448 - 46.8150*T_TT - 0.00059*T2_TT + 0.001813*T3_TT; // IAU-76/FK5 value (arcsec)
00407 
00408 
00409     /*
00410      * Compute:
00411      *          Number of Days since epoch 1990.0 (days)
00412      *          The Mean Anomaly (M)
00413      *          The True Anomaly (nu)
00414      *      The Eccentric Anomaly via Keplers equation (E)
00415      */
00416     days    = Lgm_JD( c->TT.Year,  c->TT.Month,  c->TT.Day, c->TT.Time, LGM_TIME_SYS_TT, c) - 2447891.5;
00417     varep90 = 279.403303*RadPerDeg;
00418     varpi90 = 282.768422*RadPerDeg;
00419     M       = Lgm_angle2pi(M_2PI/365.242191*days );
00420     M       = Lgm_angle2pi( M + varep90 - varpi90 );
00421     E       = Lgm_kepler(M, eccen);
00422     nu      = 2.0*atan( sqrt((1.0+eccen)/(1.0-eccen))*tan(E/2.0) );
00423     lambnew = Lgm_angle2pi(nu + varpi90);
00424 
00425     c->lambda_sun = lambnew;
00426 
00427     
00428     /*
00429      *  Compute distance from earth to the sun
00430      */
00431     r0 = 1.495985e8;  /* in km */
00432     earth_sun_distance  = r0*(1-eccen*eccen)/(1.0 + eccen*cos(nu))/Re;
00433     c->earth_sun_dist = earth_sun_distance;
00434     
00435 
00436     /*
00437      * Compute Right Ascension and Declination of the Sun
00438      * Low precision...
00439      */
00440     epsilon = c->epsilon*RadPerArcSec; // radians
00441     cos_epsilon = cos(epsilon); sin_epsilon = sin(epsilon); sin_lambnew = sin(lambnew);
00442     RA  = Lgm_angle360(atan2(sin_lambnew*cos_epsilon, cos(lambnew))*DegPerRad);
00443     DEC = asin(sin_epsilon*sin_lambnew)*DegPerRad;
00444     c->RA_sun  = RA;
00445     c->DEC_sun = DEC;
00446 
00447 
00448     if ( USE_HIGH_ACCURACY_SUN ) {
00449 //        T = (Lgm_JD( year, month, day, c->TT, c ) - 2451545.0)/36525.0;
00450         Lgm_SunPosition( T_TT, &l, &r, &b );
00451         c->lambda_sun_ha = l;       // high accuracy values
00452         c->r_sun_ha      = r*AU/Re; // high accuracy values
00453         c->beta_sun_ha   = b;       // high accuracy values
00454         sin_b = sin(b); cos_b = cos(b); sin_l = sin(l);
00455         RA  = Lgm_angle360( atan2( cos_epsilon*cos_b*sin_l-sin_epsilon*sin_b, cos_b*cos(l) )*DegPerRad );
00456         DEC = asin( sin_epsilon*cos_b*sin_l + cos_epsilon*sin_b )*DegPerRad;
00457         c->RA_sun_ha  = RA;  // high accuracy RA
00458         c->DEC_sun_ha = DEC; // high accuracy DEC
00459     }
00460     
00461 
00462 
00463 
00464     /*
00465      * Compute Precession angles to go from J2000 Epoch (we call this GEI here) to Mean Of Date (MOD) system.  
00466      * Mean of Date has corrections for precession, but not nutation.
00467      * (e.g. see "Reduction for Precession -- rigorous formulae" in Astronomical Almanac 2004 page B18)
00468      */
00469 //    TU = (Lgm_JD( year, month, day, TDT, c ) - 2451545.0)/36525.0;
00470 //    TU2 = TU*TU;
00471 //    TU3 = TU*TU2;
00472 //    Zeta  = (0.6406161*TU + 0.0000839*TU2 + 5.0e-6*TU3)*RadPerDeg;
00473 //    Zee   = (0.6406161*TU + 0.0003041*TU2 + 5.1e-6*TU3)*RadPerDeg;
00474 //    Theta = (0.5567530*TU - 0.0001185*TU2 - 1.16e-5*TU3)*RadPerDeg;
00475     c->Zeta  = 0.6406161*T_TT + 0.0000839*T2_TT + 5.0e-6*T3_TT;   // degrees
00476     c->Zee   = 0.6406161*T_TT + 0.0003041*T2_TT + 5.1e-6*T3_TT;   // degrees
00477     c->Theta = 0.5567530*T_TT - 0.0001185*T2_TT - 1.16e-5*T3_TT;  // degrees
00478     Zeta = c->Zeta*RadPerDeg; Theta = c->Theta*RadPerDeg; Zee = c->Zee*RadPerDeg;
00479     SinZee   = sin(Zee);   CosZee   = cos(Zee);
00480     SinZeta  = sin(Zeta);  CosZeta  = cos(Zeta);
00481     SinTheta = sin(Theta); CosTheta = cos(Theta);
00482     c->Agei_to_mod[0][0] = CosZeta*CosTheta*CosZee-SinZeta*SinZee; c->Agei_to_mod[1][0] = -SinZeta*CosTheta*CosZee-CosZeta*SinZee; c->Agei_to_mod[2][0] = -SinTheta*CosZee;
00483     c->Agei_to_mod[0][1] = CosZeta*CosTheta*SinZee+SinZeta*CosZee; c->Agei_to_mod[1][1] = -SinZeta*CosTheta*SinZee+CosZeta*CosZee; c->Agei_to_mod[2][1] = -SinTheta*SinZee;
00484     c->Agei_to_mod[0][2] = CosZeta*SinTheta;                       c->Agei_to_mod[1][2] = -SinZeta*SinTheta;                       c->Agei_to_mod[2][2] = CosTheta;
00485     for (i=0; i<3; i++){
00486         for (j=0; j<3; j++){
00487             c->Amod_to_gei[i][j] = c->Agei_to_mod[j][i];
00488         }
00489     }
00490 
00491 
00492     /*
00493      * Set up transformation to go from MOD->TOD
00494      * This requires calculating nutation quantities.
00495      * Here we do the full 106-term series. Could limit this if its too slow...
00496      */
00497 //    c->OmegaMoon = (450160.398036 - 6962890.5431*T_TT + 7.4722*T2_TT + 0.007702*T3_TT - 0.00005939*T4_TT)*RadPerArcSec;
00498     c->OmegaMoon = fmod( 125.04455501 - (5.0*360.0    + 134.1361851)*T_TT + 0.0020756*T2_TT +  2.139e-6*T3_TT, 360.0); // degrees
00499 
00500     // Get dPSi and dEps in arcsec
00501     Lgm_Nutation( c->TT.T, c->nNutationTerms, &(c->dPsi), &(c->dEps) ); // does 106-term nutation series
00502     c->dPsi += c->ddPsi;    // apply EOP corrections (arcsec)
00503     c->dEps += c->ddEps;    // apply EOP corrections (arcsec)
00504     // Equation of the equinoxes EQ_Eq 
00505     c->EQ_Eq = c->dPsi*cos(epsilon) + 0.00264*sin( c->OmegaMoon*RadPerDeg ) + 0.000063*sin( 2.0*c->OmegaMoon*RadPerDeg ); // arcsec
00506     // true obliquity of ecliptic
00507     c->epsilon_true = c->dEps + c->epsilon;  // arcsec
00508 //printf("c->epsilon_true/3600.0 = %15.10lf\n", c->epsilon_true/3600.0);
00509 //printf("c->dEps/3600.0 + c->epsilon/3600.0 = %15.10lf\n", c->dEps/3600.0 + c->epsilon/3600.0);
00510     tmp = c->dPsi*RadPerArcSec;           sdp = sin( tmp ); cdp = cos( tmp ); 
00511     tmp = c->epsilon*RadPerArcSec;        se  = sin( tmp ); ce  = cos( tmp );
00512     tmp = c->epsilon_true*RadPerArcSec;   set = sin( tmp ); cet = cos( tmp );
00513     c->Atod_to_mod[0][0] =  cdp;    c->Atod_to_mod[1][0] = sdp*cet;              c->Atod_to_mod[2][0] = set*sdp;
00514     c->Atod_to_mod[0][1] = -sdp*ce; c->Atod_to_mod[1][1] = cet*cdp*ce + set*se;  c->Atod_to_mod[2][1] = set*cdp*ce - se*cet;
00515     c->Atod_to_mod[0][2] = -sdp*se; c->Atod_to_mod[1][2] = cet*cdp*se - set*ce;  c->Atod_to_mod[2][2] = set*se*cdp + cet*ce;
00516     for (i=0; i<3; i++){
00517         for (j=0; j<3; j++){
00518             c->Amod_to_tod[i][j] = c->Atod_to_mod[j][i];
00519         }
00520     }
00521     
00522 
00523 
00524 
00525     
00526     
00527     /*
00528      * Set up transformation between PEF and TOD
00529      * Need to compute True (Aparent?) Sidereal Time GAST
00530      */
00531     c->gast = c->gmst*15.0 + c->EQ_Eq/3600.0;
00532     gast = c->gast*RadPerDeg; cs = cos( gast ); sn = sin( gast );
00533     c->Atod_to_pef[0][0] =  cs; c->Atod_to_pef[1][0] =  sn; c->Atod_to_pef[2][0] = 0.0;
00534     c->Atod_to_pef[0][1] = -sn; c->Atod_to_pef[1][1] =  cs; c->Atod_to_pef[2][1] = 0.0;
00535     c->Atod_to_pef[0][2] = 0.0; c->Atod_to_pef[1][2] = 0.0; c->Atod_to_pef[2][2] = 1.0;
00536 
00537     c->Apef_to_tod[0][0] =  cs; c->Apef_to_tod[1][0] = -sn; c->Apef_to_tod[2][0] = 0.0;
00538     c->Apef_to_tod[0][1] =  sn; c->Apef_to_tod[1][1] =  cs; c->Apef_to_tod[2][1] = 0.0;
00539     c->Apef_to_tod[0][2] = 0.0; c->Apef_to_tod[1][2] = 0.0; c->Apef_to_tod[2][2] = 1.0;
00540     
00541     
00542 
00543 
00544 
00545 
00546     /*
00547      * Set up transformation between TOD and TEME
00548      * Utod = Rz( dPsiCosEps ) Uteme 
00549      *    CHECK THIS. Do we use Full equation of equinoxes???
00550      *    OR just dPsi*cos( eps )????
00551      */
00552     //sn = sin( c->dPsiCosEps ); cs = cos( c->dPsiCosEps );
00553 //    double ang = c->dPsi * cos(c->epsilon_true);
00554 //    sn = sin( ang ); cs = cos( ang );
00555 //    c->Ateme_to_tod[0][0] =  cs; c->Ateme_to_tod[1][0] =  sn; c->Ateme_to_tod[2][0] = 0.0;
00556 //    c->Ateme_to_tod[0][1] = -sn; c->Ateme_to_tod[1][1] =  cs; c->Ateme_to_tod[2][1] = 0.0;
00557 //    c->Ateme_to_tod[0][2] = 0.0; c->Ateme_to_tod[1][2] = 0.0; c->Ateme_to_tod[2][2] = 1.0;
00558 //
00559 //    c->Atod_to_teme[0][0] =  cs; c->Atod_to_teme[1][0] = -sn; c->Atod_to_teme[2][0] = 0.0;
00560 //    c->Atod_to_teme[0][1] =  sn; c->Atod_to_teme[1][1] =  cs; c->Atod_to_teme[2][1] = 0.0;
00561 //    c->Atod_to_teme[0][2] = 0.0; c->Atod_to_teme[1][2] = 0.0; c->Atod_to_teme[2][2] = 1.0;
00562 
00563     /*
00564      * Lets set this up differently because Vallado and others just arent clear on how exactly to
00565      * go from TEME to TOD (too many approximations seem to be available). Instead, follow Vallado's
00566      * recommendation and go the PEF instead. This is also good because we have gmst already!
00567      * See Vallado's book and his article "Revisiting Spacetrack Report #3".
00568      *   Upef = Rz( gmst82 ) Uteme
00569      */
00570       sn = sin( gmst ); cs = cos( gmst );
00571       c->Ateme_to_pef[0][0] =  cs; c->Ateme_to_pef[1][0] =  sn; c->Ateme_to_pef[2][0] = 0.0;
00572       c->Ateme_to_pef[0][1] = -sn; c->Ateme_to_pef[1][1] =  cs; c->Ateme_to_pef[2][1] = 0.0;
00573       c->Ateme_to_pef[0][2] = 0.0; c->Ateme_to_pef[1][2] = 0.0; c->Ateme_to_pef[2][2] = 1.0;
00574     
00575       c->Apef_to_teme[0][0] =  cs; c->Apef_to_teme[1][0] = -sn; c->Apef_to_teme[2][0] = 0.0;
00576       c->Apef_to_teme[0][1] =  sn; c->Apef_to_teme[1][1] =  cs; c->Apef_to_teme[2][1] = 0.0;
00577       c->Apef_to_teme[0][2] = 0.0; c->Apef_to_teme[1][2] = 0.0; c->Apef_to_teme[2][2] = 1.0;
00578 
00579 
00580 
00581 
00582     
00583 
00584     /*
00585      * Set up transformation between WGS84 and PEF
00586      * Uwgs84 = Ry( -xp )Rz( -yp ) Upef 
00587      */
00588     sxp = sin( c->xp*RadPerArcSec ); cxp = cos( c->xp*RadPerArcSec );
00589     syp = sin( c->yp*RadPerArcSec ); cyp = cos( c->yp*RadPerArcSec );
00590     c->Apef_to_wgs84[0][0] =  cxp;     c->Apef_to_wgs84[1][0] =  sxp*syp; c->Apef_to_wgs84[2][0] = sxp*cyp;
00591     c->Apef_to_wgs84[0][1] =  0.0;     c->Apef_to_wgs84[1][1] =      cyp; c->Apef_to_wgs84[2][1] = -syp;
00592     c->Apef_to_wgs84[0][2] = -sxp;     c->Apef_to_wgs84[1][2] =  cxp*syp; c->Apef_to_wgs84[2][2] = cxp*cyp;
00593 
00594     c->Awgs84_to_pef[0][0] =  cxp;     c->Awgs84_to_pef[1][0] =      0.0; c->Awgs84_to_pef[2][0] = -sxp;
00595     c->Awgs84_to_pef[0][1] =  sxp*syp; c->Awgs84_to_pef[1][1] =      cyp; c->Awgs84_to_pef[2][1] =  cxp*syp;
00596     c->Awgs84_to_pef[0][2] =  sxp*cyp; c->Awgs84_to_pef[1][2] =     -syp; c->Awgs84_to_pef[2][2] =  cxp*cyp;
00597 
00598 
00599 //    c->Apef_to_wgs84[0][0] =    1.0; c->Apef_to_wgs84[1][0] =    0.0; c->Apef_to_wgs84[2][0] =  c->xp;
00600 //    c->Apef_to_wgs84[0][1] =    0.0; c->Apef_to_wgs84[1][1] =    1.0; c->Apef_to_wgs84[2][1] = -c->yp;
00601 //    c->Apef_to_wgs84[0][2] = -c->xp; c->Apef_to_wgs84[1][2] =  c->yp; c->Apef_to_wgs84[2][2] =    1.0;
00602 //
00603 //    c->Awgs84_to_pef[0][0] =    1.0; c->Awgs84_to_pef[1][0] =     0.0; c->Awgs84_to_pef[2][0] = -c->xp;
00604 //    c->Awgs84_to_pef[0][1] =    0.0; c->Awgs84_to_pef[1][1] =     1.0; c->Awgs84_to_pef[2][1] =  c->yp;
00605 //    c->Awgs84_to_pef[0][2] =  c->xp; c->Awgs84_to_pef[1][2] =  -c->yp; c->Awgs84_to_pef[2][2] =    1.0;
00606 
00607 
00608 
00609 
00610 
00611 
00612     /*
00613      * Compute Right Ascension and Declination of the Moon
00614      */
00615     Lmoon_0 = 318.351648;
00616     P0 = 36.340410;
00617     N0 = 318.510107;
00618     Imoon = 5.145396;
00619     days  = Lgm_JD( c->TT.Year,  c->TT.Month,  c->TT.Day, c->TT.Time, LGM_TIME_SYS_TT, c) - 2447891.5;
00620     Lmoon = 13.1763966*days + Lmoon_0;
00621     Mmoon_m = Lmoon - 0.1114041*days - P0;
00622     Nmoon = N0 - 0.0529539*days;
00623     Cmoon = Lmoon*RadPerDeg - lambnew;
00624     Emoon_nu = 1.2739*sin(2.0*Cmoon - Mmoon_m*RadPerDeg);
00625     Amoon_e = 0.1858*sin(M);
00626     Amoon_3 = 0.37*sin(M);
00627     Mmoon_mp = Mmoon_m + Emoon_nu - Amoon_e - Amoon_3;
00628     Emoon_c = 6.2886*sin(Mmoon_mp*RadPerDeg);
00629     Amoon_4 = 0.214*sin(2.0*Mmoon_mp*RadPerDeg);
00630     Lmoon_p = Lmoon + Emoon_nu + Emoon_c - Amoon_e + Amoon_4;
00631     Vmoon = 0.6583*sin(2.0*(Lmoon_p*RadPerDeg - lambnew));
00632     Lmoon_pp = Lmoon_p + Vmoon;
00633     Nmoon_p = Nmoon - 0.16*sin(M);
00634     LambdaMoon = atan2( sin((Lmoon_pp - Nmoon_p)*RadPerDeg)*cos(Imoon*RadPerDeg), 
00635             cos((Lmoon_pp - Nmoon_p)*RadPerDeg) ) + Nmoon_p*RadPerDeg;
00636     BetaMoon = asin(sin((Lmoon_pp - Nmoon_p)*RadPerDeg)*sin(Imoon*RadPerDeg));
00637     RA_Moon  = Lgm_angle360(atan2(sin(LambdaMoon)*cos(epsilon)-tan(BetaMoon)*sin(epsilon), 
00638         cos(LambdaMoon))*DegPerRad);
00639     DEC_Moon = asin( sin(BetaMoon)*cos(epsilon) + cos(BetaMoon)*sin(epsilon)*sin(LambdaMoon))*DegPerRad;
00640     c->RA_moon = RA_Moon;
00641     c->DEC_moon = DEC_Moon;
00642 
00643  
00644     /*
00645      * Compute Phase of the Moon
00646      */
00647     c->MoonPhase = 0.5*(1.0 - cos(Lmoon_pp*RadPerDeg - lambnew));
00648   
00649     
00650     /*
00651      * Compute Earth-Moon distance
00652      */
00653     amoon = 384401.0;
00654     emoon = 0.054900;
00655     c->EarthMoonDistance = amoon*(1.0 - emoon*emoon)/(1.0 + emoon*cos((Mmoon_mp + Emoon_c)*RadPerDeg));
00656     c->EarthMoonDistance /= Re;
00657 
00658 
00659 
00660 
00661     /*
00662      *  Define MOD <--> GSE Transformation
00663      */
00664 
00665     // Direction of the Sun in MOD coords
00666     S.x = cos(lambnew);
00667     S.y = cos(epsilon)*sin(lambnew);
00668     S.z = sin(epsilon)*sin(lambnew);
00669     c->Sun = S;
00670 
00671     // Compute the direction of the Ecliptic Pole in the MOD system
00672     K.x =  0.0;
00673     K.y = -sin(epsilon);
00674     K.z =  cos(epsilon);
00675     c->EcPole = K;
00676 
00677     //  Taking X in direction of sun and Z parrallel to K (ec. pole),
00678     //  compute the Y axis direction.
00679     Lgm_CrossProduct(&K, &S, &Y);
00680 
00681     //  Create transformation matrix from GEI to GSE (c->Amod_to_gse[cols][rows])
00682     c->Amod_to_gse[0][0] = S.x, c->Amod_to_gse[1][0] = S.y, c->Amod_to_gse[2][0] = S.z;
00683     c->Amod_to_gse[0][1] = Y.x, c->Amod_to_gse[1][1] = Y.y, c->Amod_to_gse[2][1] = Y.z;
00684     c->Amod_to_gse[0][2] = K.x, c->Amod_to_gse[1][2] = K.y, c->Amod_to_gse[2][2] = K.z;
00685 
00686     c->Agse_to_mod[0][0] = S.x, c->Agse_to_mod[1][0] = Y.x, c->Agse_to_mod[2][0] = K.x;
00687     c->Agse_to_mod[0][1] = S.y, c->Agse_to_mod[1][1] = Y.y, c->Agse_to_mod[2][1] = K.y;
00688     c->Agse_to_mod[0][2] = S.z, c->Agse_to_mod[1][2] = Y.z, c->Agse_to_mod[2][2] = K.z;
00689 
00690     
00691 
00692 
00693 
00694 
00695 
00696 
00697 
00698     /*
00699      *  Initialize IGRF to get (among other things) the dipole moment.
00700      *  We really should do this more carefully. Make sure the lat/lons
00701      *  are geocentric?
00702      */
00703     N = 10;
00704 //    c->UTC.fYear = (double)c->year + ((double)c->doy + c->UTC/24.0)/(365.0 + (double)Lgm_LeapYear(c->year));
00705     c->Lgm_IGRF_FirstCall = TRUE;
00706     Lgm_InitIGRF( g, h, N, 1, c );
00707     gclat = c->CD_gcolat;
00708     glon  = c->CD_glon;
00709 
00710 
00711 
00712 
00713 
00714 
00715     /*
00716      *   Construct Transformation Matrix from MOD to GSM 
00717      *
00718      *   First compute the location of the earths D axis based on IGRF
00719      *   coefficients. Note: we compute Dhat as thoughj it were sticking out of the north
00720      *   hemisphere. It really goes out the south, but its less confusing this way...
00721      *   
00722      */
00723     c->CD_gcolat = gclat*DegPerRad;
00724     c->CD_glon   = glon*DegPerRad;
00725     D.x   = cos(glon)*sin(gclat);
00726     D.y   = sin(glon)*sin(gclat);
00727     D.z   = cos(gclat);
00728 
00729     //  Find D (i.e. dipole) axis in MOD system
00730     Dmod.x = cos(gmst)*D.x - sin(gmst)*D.y;
00731     Dmod.y = sin(gmst)*D.x + cos(gmst)*D.y;
00732     Dmod.z = D.z;
00733 
00734     // Compute Ygsm axis in MOD system 
00735     Lgm_CrossProduct(&Dmod, &S, &Y);
00736 
00737     //  Normalize the Y vector 
00738     Lgm_NormalizeVector(&Y);
00739 
00740     //  Compute Zgsm axis in MOD system
00741     Lgm_CrossProduct(&S, &Y, &Z);
00742 
00743     c->Amod_to_gsm[0][0] = S.x, c->Amod_to_gsm[1][0] = S.y, c->Amod_to_gsm[2][0] = S.z;
00744     c->Amod_to_gsm[0][1] = Y.x, c->Amod_to_gsm[1][1] = Y.y, c->Amod_to_gsm[2][1] = Y.z;
00745     c->Amod_to_gsm[0][2] = Z.x, c->Amod_to_gsm[1][2] = Z.y, c->Amod_to_gsm[2][2] = Z.z;
00746     
00747     c->Agsm_to_mod[0][0] = S.x, c->Agsm_to_mod[1][0] = Y.x, c->Agsm_to_mod[2][0] = Z.x;
00748     c->Agsm_to_mod[0][1] = S.y, c->Agsm_to_mod[1][1] = Y.y, c->Agsm_to_mod[2][1] = Z.y;
00749     c->Agsm_to_mod[0][2] = S.z, c->Agsm_to_mod[1][2] = Y.z, c->Agsm_to_mod[2][2] = Z.z;
00750 
00751 
00752 
00753 
00754 
00755 
00756 
00757 
00758     /*
00759      *  Compute the Dipole Tilt angle. First convert Dmod into GSM.
00760      *  Then psi is just the angle between Dgsm and Zgsm
00761      */
00762     Dgsm.x = c->Amod_to_gsm[0][0]*Dmod.x + c->Amod_to_gsm[1][0]*Dmod.y + c->Amod_to_gsm[2][0]*Dmod.z;
00763     Dgsm.y = c->Amod_to_gsm[0][1]*Dmod.x + c->Amod_to_gsm[1][1]*Dmod.y + c->Amod_to_gsm[2][1]*Dmod.z;
00764     Dgsm.z = c->Amod_to_gsm[0][2]*Dmod.x + c->Amod_to_gsm[1][2]*Dmod.y + c->Amod_to_gsm[2][2]*Dmod.z;
00765         
00766     spsi       = sqrt( Dgsm.x*Dgsm.x + Dgsm.y*Dgsm.y );
00767     psi        = asin( spsi );
00768     psi       *= ( Dgsm.x < 0.0 ) ? -1.0 : 1.0;
00769     c->psi     = psi;
00770     c->cos_psi = cos( psi );
00771     c->sin_psi = sin( psi );
00772     c->tan_psi = c->sin_psi/c->cos_psi;
00773 
00774 
00775     /*
00776      *  Construct trans. matrices for GSM <-> SM
00777      */
00778     c->Agsm_to_sm[0][0] = c->cos_psi, c->Agsm_to_sm[1][0] = 0.0, c->Agsm_to_sm[2][0] = -c->sin_psi;
00779     c->Agsm_to_sm[0][1] = 0.0,        c->Agsm_to_sm[1][1] = 1.0, c->Agsm_to_sm[2][1] =  0.0;
00780     c->Agsm_to_sm[0][2] = c->sin_psi, c->Agsm_to_sm[1][2] = 0.0, c->Agsm_to_sm[2][2] =  c->cos_psi;
00781     Lgm_Transpose( c->Agsm_to_sm, c->Asm_to_gsm );
00782     
00783 
00784     /*
00785      *  Now do WGS84 (i.e. GEO) <-> CDMAG
00786      *    Z: parallel to dipole axis.
00787      *    Y: perp to both Z and Rot axis.
00788      *    X: completes
00789      */
00790     Zgeo.x = 0.0; Zgeo.y = 0.0; Zgeo.z = 1.0;
00791     Lgm_CrossProduct(&Zgeo, &D, &Y); // Ycdmag-hat in geo coords.
00792     Lgm_NormalizeVector(&Y);
00793     Lgm_CrossProduct(&Y, &D, &X);    // Xcdmag-hat in geo coords.
00794     Lgm_NormalizeVector(&X);
00795     c->Awgs84_to_cdmag[0][0] = X.x, c->Awgs84_to_cdmag[1][0] = X.y, c->Awgs84_to_cdmag[2][0] =  X.z;
00796     c->Awgs84_to_cdmag[0][1] = Y.x, c->Awgs84_to_cdmag[1][1] = Y.y, c->Awgs84_to_cdmag[2][1] =  Y.z;
00797     c->Awgs84_to_cdmag[0][2] = D.x, c->Awgs84_to_cdmag[1][2] = D.y, c->Awgs84_to_cdmag[2][2] =  D.z;
00798 
00799     c->Acdmag_to_wgs84[0][0] = X.x, c->Acdmag_to_wgs84[1][0] = Y.x, c->Acdmag_to_wgs84[2][0] =  D.x;
00800     c->Acdmag_to_wgs84[0][1] = X.y, c->Acdmag_to_wgs84[1][1] = Y.y, c->Acdmag_to_wgs84[2][1] =  D.y;
00801     c->Acdmag_to_wgs84[0][2] = X.z, c->Acdmag_to_wgs84[1][2] = Y.z, c->Acdmag_to_wgs84[2][2] =  D.z;
00802 
00803 
00804 
00805 
00806 
00807 
00808     /*  Construct transformation matrix from GSM to GSE and vice versa ;
00809      *  Agsm_to_gse = Amod_to_gse * Agsm_to_mod
00810      */
00811     Lgm_MatTimesMat( c->Amod_to_gse, c->Agsm_to_mod, c->Agsm_to_gse );
00812     Lgm_Transpose( c->Agsm_to_gse, c->Agse_to_gsm);
00813 /*
00814     for (j=0; j<3; ++j){
00815         for (i=0; i<3; ++i){
00816             c->Agsm_to_gse[i][j] = c->Amod_to_gse[0][j]*c->Amod_to_gsm[0][i] 
00817                                     + c->Amod_to_gse[1][j]*c->Amod_to_gsm[1][i]
00818                                     + c->Amod_to_gse[2][j]*c->Amod_to_gsm[2][i];
00819             c->Agse_to_gsm[i][j] = c->Amod_to_gsm[0][j]*c->Amod_to_gse[0][i] 
00820                                     + c->Amod_to_gsm[1][j]*c->Amod_to_gse[1][i]
00821                                     + c->Amod_to_gsm[2][j]*c->Amod_to_gse[2][i];
00822         }
00823     }
00824 */
00825 
00826 
00827     /*  Construct transformation matrix from GSM to WGS84 and vice versa ;
00828      *  Agsm_to_wgs84 = Amod_to_wgs84 * Agsm_to_mod
00829      *  Awgs84_to_gsm = Transpose( Agsm_to_wgs84 )
00830      */
00831     Lgm_MatTimesMat( c->Amod_to_wgs84, c->Agsm_to_mod, c->Agsm_to_wgs84 );
00832     Lgm_Transpose( c->Agsm_to_wgs84, c->Awgs84_to_gsm );
00833 /*
00834     for (j=0; j<3; ++j){
00835         for (i=0; i<3; ++i){
00836             c->Agsm_to_wgs84[i][j] = c->Amod_to_wgs84[0][j]*c->Agsm_to_mod[i][0] 
00837                                     + c->Amod_to_wgs84[1][j]*c->Agsm_to_mod[i][1]
00838                                     + c->Amod_to_wgs84[2][j]*c->Agsm_to_mod[i][2];
00839             c->Awgs84_to_gsm[i][j] = c->Amod_to_gsm[0][j]*c->Awgs84_to_mod[i][0] 
00840                                     + c->Amod_to_gsm[1][j]*c->Awgs84_to_mod[i][1]
00841                                     + c->Amod_to_gsm[2][j]*c->Awgs84_to_mod[i][2];
00842         }
00843     }
00844 */
00845 
00846 
00847 
00848     /*
00849      *  Construct Transformation Matricies between  WGS84 and MOD 
00850      *  and between WGS84 and GEI
00851      */
00852     Lgm_MatTimesMat( c->Apef_to_tod, c->Awgs84_to_pef, Tmp );
00853     Lgm_MatTimesMat( c->Atod_to_mod, Tmp, c->Awgs84_to_mod );
00854     Lgm_MatTimesMat( c->Amod_to_gei, c->Awgs84_to_mod, c->Awgs84_to_gei );
00855     Lgm_Transpose( c->Awgs84_to_mod, c->Amod_to_wgs84 );
00856     Lgm_Transpose( c->Awgs84_to_gei, c->Agei_to_wgs84 );

00927         Lgm_Convert_Coords( &u_mod, &u_tod, MOD_TO_TOD, c );
00928         RA_tod = atan2( u_tod.y, u_tod.x)*DegPerRad; if (RA_tod<0.0) RA_tod += 360.0;
00929         DEC_tod = asin( u_tod.z )*DegPerRad;
00930         printf("    RA_sun  (TOD)   = %15lf  ( ",  RA_tod);      Lgm_Print_HMSd( RA_tod/15.0 ); printf(" )\n");

00933         RA_gei = atan2( u_gei.y, u_gei.x)*DegPerRad; if (RA_gei<0.0) RA_gei += 360.0;
00934         DEC_gei = asin( u_gei.z )*DegPerRad;
00935         printf("    RA_sun  (J2000) = %15lf  ( ",  RA_gei);      Lgm_Print_HMSd( RA_gei/15.0 ); printf(" )\n");

01056         printf("    Ateme_to_pef      = [ %15.8e  %15.8e  %15.8e ]\n",   c->Ateme_to_pef[0][1], c->Ateme_to_pef[1][1], c->Ateme_to_pef[2][1]);
01057         printf("                        [ %15.8e  %15.8e  %15.8e ]\n\n", c->Ateme_to_pef[0][2], c->Ateme_to_pef[1][2], c->Ateme_to_pef[2][2]);
01058 
01059         printf("                        [ %15.8e  %15.8e  %15.8e ]\n",   c->Apef_to_teme[0][0], c->Apef_to_teme[1][0], c->Apef_to_teme[2][0]);
01060         printf("    Apef_to_teme      = [ %15.8e  %15.8e  %15.8e ]\n",   c->Apef_to_teme[0][1], c->Apef_to_teme[1][1], c->Apef_to_teme[2][1]);
01061         printf("                        [ %15.8e  %15.8e  %15.8e ]\n\n", c->Apef_to_teme[0][2], c->Apef_to_teme[1][2], c->Apef_to_teme[2][2]);
01062 
01063         printf("                        [ %15.8e  %15.8e  %15.8e ]\n",   c->Awgs84_to_pef[0][0], c->Awgs84_to_pef[1][0], c->Awgs84_to_pef[2][0]);
01064         printf("    Awgs84_to_pef     = [ %15.8e  %15.8e  %15.8e ]\n",   c->Awgs84_to_pef[0][1], c->Awgs84_to_pef[1][1], c->Awgs84_to_pef[2][1]);
01065         printf("                        [ %15.8e  %15.8e  %15.8e ]\n\n", c->Awgs84_to_pef[0][2], c->Awgs84_to_pef[1][2], c->Awgs84_to_pef[2][2]);
01066 
01067         printf("                        [ %15.8e  %15.8e  %15.8e ]\n",   c->Apef_to_wgs84[0][0], c->Apef_to_wgs84[1][0], c->Apef_to_wgs84[2][0]);
01068         printf("    Apef_to_wgs84     = [ %15.8e  %15.8e  %15.8e ]\n",   c->Apef_to_wgs84[0][1], c->Apef_to_wgs84[1][1], c->Apef_to_wgs84[2][1]);
01069         printf("                        [ %15.8e  %15.8e  %15.8e ]\n\n", c->Apef_to_wgs84[0][2], c->Apef_to_wgs84[1][2], c->Apef_to_wgs84[2][2]);
01070     }
01071 
01072 }
01073 
01074 
01075 /*
01076  *  Routine converts coords from one system to another. All of the major
01077  *  systems aout to be defined -- see ctrans.h for flag definitions.
01078  *
01079  *     Lgm_Vector *u;      -- input vector
01080  *     Lgm_Vector *v;      -- output vector
01081  *     int     flag;       -- flag to specify the type of coord transformation
01082  *                            (see LgmCtrans.h for description of whats available)
01083  *     Lgm_CTrans *c;      -- structure that holds all the coord trans info
01084  *
01085  */
01086 void Lgm_Convert_Coords(Lgm_Vector *u, Lgm_Vector *v, int flag, Lgm_CTrans *c) {
01087 
01088     Lgm_Vector  w, r, z, e, d;
01089     int         inflag, outflag;
01090 
01091     /*
01092      *  Figure out what system the input coords are in 
01093      *  and what system the output coords should be in...
01094      */
01095     inflag = (int)((float)flag/100.0);
01096     outflag = flag - inflag*100;
01097 
01098     /*
01099      * Catch case where in coords are same as out coords
01100      */
01101     if (inflag == outflag) {
01102         v->x = u->x;
01103         v->y = u->y;
01104         v->z = u->z;
01105         return;
01106     }
01107 
01108     /*
01109      *  Cant have trans matrices from everything to everything.
01110      *  So we pick a common system to transform in and out of.
01111      *  Lets choose MOD since its pretty common
01112      */
01113 
01114 
01115     /*
01116      *   convert coords to a common system: use MOD...
01117      */
01118     switch(inflag){
01119         case EME2000_COORDS:    // in coords are in EME2000 (aka ICRF2000 or GEI2000)
01120              // aka ICRF2000_COORDS
01121              // aka GEI2000_COORDS
01122             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Agei_to_mod, u, &w);
01123             break;
01124         case MOD_COORDS:    // in coords are in MOD
01125             w.x = u->x, w.y = u->y, w.z = u->z;
01126             break;
01127         case TOD_COORDS:    // in coords are in TOD
01128             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Atod_to_mod, u, &w);
01129             break;
01130         case TEME_COORDS:   // in coords are in TEME
01131             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Ateme_to_pef, u, &r);
01132             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Apef_to_tod, &r, &z);
01133             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Atod_to_mod, &z, &w);
01134             break;
01135         case PEF_COORDS:    // in coords are in PEF
01136             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Apef_to_tod, u, &r);
01137             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Atod_to_mod, &r, &w);
01138             break;
01139         case WGS84_COORDS:  // in coords are in WGS84
01140             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Awgs84_to_pef, u, &r);
01141             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Apef_to_tod, &r, &z);
01142             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Atod_to_mod, &z, &w);
01143             break;
01144         case GSE_COORDS:    // in coords are in GSE
01145             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Agse_to_mod, u, &w);
01146             break;
01147         case GSM_COORDS:    // in coords are in GSM
01148             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Agsm_to_mod, u, &w);
01149             break;
01150         case SM_COORDS:     // in coords are in SM
01151             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Asm_to_gsm,  u, &r);
01152             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Agsm_to_mod, &r, &w);
01153             break;
01154         case CDMAG_COORDS:  // in coords are in CDMAG
01155             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Acdmag_to_wgs84, u, &r);
01156             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Awgs84_to_mod, &r, &w);
01157             break;
01158         case EDMAG_COORDS:  // in coords are in EDMAG
01159             // Convert the  dipole offset to CDMAG coords first
01160             d.x = c->ED_x0; d.y = c->ED_y0; d.z = c->ED_z0; // offset vector in wgs84 (i.e. in geo)
01161             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Awgs84_to_cdmag, &d, &e);
01162             // now Rcd = d_offset_cd + Red
01163             z.x = u->x + e.x; z.y = u->y + e.y; z.z = u->z + e.z; // Rcd = R0 + Red  (z should be in CD now)
01164             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Acdmag_to_wgs84, &z, &r);
01165             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Awgs84_to_mod, &r, &w);
01166             break;
01167     }
01168 
01169     // w now holds the coords in MOD -- now transform to desired system
01170 
01171     switch(outflag){
01172         case EME2000_COORDS:    // out coords are in EME2000 (aka ICRF2000 or GEI2000)
01173             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Amod_to_gei, &w, v);
01174             break;
01175         case MOD_COORDS:    // out coords are in MOD
01176             v->x = w.x, v->y = w.y, v->z = w.z;
01177             break;
01178         case TOD_COORDS:    // out coords are in TOD
01179             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Amod_to_tod, &w, v);
01180             break;
01181         case TEME_COORDS:   // out coords are in TEME
01182             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Amod_to_tod, &w, &r);
01183             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Atod_to_pef, &r, &z);
01184             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Apef_to_teme, &z, v);
01185             break;
01186         case PEF_COORDS:    // out coords are in PEF
01187             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Amod_to_tod, &w, &r);
01188             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Atod_to_pef, &r, v);
01189             break;
01190         case WGS84_COORDS:  // out coords are in WGS84
01191             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Amod_to_tod, &w, &r);
01192             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Atod_to_pef, &r, &z);
01193             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Apef_to_wgs84, &z, v);
01194             break;
01195         case GSE_COORDS:    // out coords are in GSE
01196             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Amod_to_gse, &w, v);
01197             break;
01198         case GSM_COORDS:    // out coords are in GSM
01199             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Amod_to_gsm, &w, v);
01200             break;
01201         case SM_COORDS:     // out coords are in SM
01202             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Amod_to_gsm, &w, &r);
01203             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Agsm_to_sm,  &r, v);
01204             break;
01205         case CDMAG_COORDS:  // out coords are in CDMAG
01206             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Amod_to_wgs84, &w, &r);
01207             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Awgs84_to_cdmag, &r, v);
01208             break;
01209         case EDMAG_COORDS:  // out coords are in ED
01210             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Amod_to_wgs84, &w, &r);
01211             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Awgs84_to_cdmag, &r, &z);
01212             // Convert the  dipole offset to CDMAG coords
01213             d.x = c->ED_x0; d.y = c->ED_y0; d.z = c->ED_z0; // offset vector in wgs84 (i.e. in geo)
01214             Lgm_MatTimesVec(c->Awgs84_to_cdmag, &d, &e);
01215             // now Rcd - d_offset_cd = Red
01216             v->x = z.x - e.x; v->y = z.y - e.y; v->z = z.z - e.z; // Rcd - R0 = Red  (z should be in ED now)
01217             break;
01218         }
01219 
01220     
01221 }
01222 
01223 
01224 /*
01225  * Input:
01226  *          GeodLat:    in degrees
01227  *          GeodLong:   in degrees
01228  *          GeodHeight: in km
01229  *
01230  * Output:
01231  *          v: in Re
01232  */
01233 void Lgm_GEOD_to_WGS84( double GeodLat, double GeodLong, double GeodHeight, Lgm_Vector *v ) {
01234 
01235     double      lam, phi, h, CosPhi, SinPhi, CosLam, SinLam, Chi;
01236 
01237     lam = GeodLat*RadPerDeg;
01238     phi = GeodLong*RadPerDeg;
01239     h   = GeodHeight;
01240 
01241     CosPhi = cos(phi); SinPhi = sin(phi); SinLam = sin(lam); CosLam = cos(lam);
01242     Chi = sqrt( 1.0 - WGS84_E2*SinLam*SinLam );
01243 
01244     // convert to GEO (in units of Re)
01245     v->x = (WGS84_A/Chi + h)*CosLam*CosPhi/WGS84_A;
01246     v->y = (WGS84_A/Chi + h)*CosLam*SinPhi/WGS84_A;
01247     v->z = (WGS84_A*(1.0-WGS84_E2)/Chi + h)*SinLam/WGS84_A;
01248 
01249 }
01250 
01251 void Lgm_WGS84_to_GEOD( Lgm_Vector *uin, double *GeodLat, double *GeodLong, double *GeodHeight ) {
01252 
01253     Lgm_Vector u;
01254     double  r, r2, z2, F, G, G2, G3, c, s, tt, tt2, P;
01255     double  Q, ro, U, V, zo;
01256     
01257     u = *uin;
01258     Lgm_ScaleVector( &u, WGS84_A ); // convert to km
01259 
01260     r2 = u.x*u.x + u.y*u.y;
01261     r = sqrt(r2);
01262     z2 = u.z*u.z;
01263     F = 54.0*WGS84_B2*z2;
01264     G = r2 + WGS84_1mE2*z2 - WGS84_E2*WGS84_A2mB2;
01265     G2 = G*G; G3 = G2*G;
01266     c = (WGS84_E4*F*r2)/G3;
01267     s = pow( 1.0 + c + sqrt(c*c + 2.0*c), M_OneThird );
01268     tt = s + 1.0/s + 1.0; tt2 = tt*tt;
01269     P = F/( 3.0*tt2*G2 );
01270 
01271     Q = sqrt( 1.0 + 2.0*WGS84_E4*P ); 
01272     ro = -(WGS84_E2*P*r)/(1.0+Q) + sqrt( (0.5*WGS84_A2)*(1.0+1.0/Q) - (WGS84_1mE2*P*z2)/(Q*(1.0+Q)) - 0.5*P*r2 );
01273 
01274     tt = (r - WGS84_E2*ro); tt2 = tt*tt;
01275     U   = sqrt( tt2 + z2 );
01276     V   = sqrt( tt2 + WGS84_1mE2*z2 );
01277     zo  = (WGS84_B2*u.z)/(WGS84_A*V);
01278  
01279     *GeodLat    = DegPerRad*atan( (u.z + WGS84_EP2*zo)/r );  // geodetic latitude
01280     *GeodLong   =  DegPerRad*atan2( u.y, u.x );              // geodetic longitude (same as GEO)
01281     *GeodHeight = U*( 1.0 - WGS84_B2/(WGS84_A*V));           // geodetic height (km)
01282 }
01283 
01284 // same as above, but just returns height (saves a few expensive atans)
01285 void Lgm_WGS84_to_GeodHeight( Lgm_Vector *uin, double *GeodHeight ) {
01286 
01287     Lgm_Vector u;
01288     double  r, r2, z2, F, G, G2, G3, c, s, tt, tt2, P;
01289     double  Q, ro, U, V, zo;
01290     
01291     u = *uin;
01292     Lgm_ScaleVector( &u, WGS84_A ); // convert to km
01293 
01294     r2 = u.x*u.x + u.y*u.y;
01295     r = sqrt(r2);
01296     z2 = u.z*u.z;
01297     F = 54.0*WGS84_B2*z2;
01298     G = r2 + WGS84_1mE2*z2 - WGS84_E2*WGS84_A2mB2;
01299     G2 = G*G; G3 = G2*G;
01300     c = (WGS84_E4*F*r2)/G3;
01301     s = pow( 1.0 + c + sqrt(c*c + 2.0*c), M_OneThird );
01302     tt = s + 1.0/s + 1.0; tt2 = tt*tt;
01303     P = F/( 3.0*tt2*G2 );
01304 
01305     Q = sqrt( 1.0 + 2.0*WGS84_E4*P ); 
01306     ro = -(WGS84_E2*P*r)/(1.0+Q) + sqrt( (0.5*WGS84_A2)*(1.0+1.0/Q) - (WGS84_1mE2*P*z2)/(Q*(1.0+Q)) - 0.5*P*r2 );
01307 
01308     tt = (r - WGS84_E2*ro); tt2 = tt*tt;
01309     U   = sqrt( tt2 + z2 );
01310     V   = sqrt( tt2 + WGS84_1mE2*z2 );
01311     zo  = (WGS84_B2*u.z)/(WGS84_A*V);
01312  
01313     *GeodHeight = U*( 1.0 - WGS84_B2/(WGS84_A*V));           // geodetic height (km)
01314 }
01315 
01316 
01317 
01318 /*
01319  *  These rotuines are included here, just because its trivial
01320  *  to do it here. 
01321  */
01322 void Lgm_B_igrf_ctrans(Lgm_Vector *v, Lgm_Vector *B, Lgm_CTrans *c) {
01323 
01324     double  st, ct, sp, cp;
01325     double  B_r, B_theta, B_phi;
01326     double  r, theta, phi;
01327     Lgm_Vector  w, Bgeo;
01328 
01329 
01330     /*
01331      *  Convert Coords to GEO
01332      */
01333     Lgm_Convert_Coords( v, &w, GSM_TO_WGS84, c );
01334 
01335 
01336     /* 
01337      *  compute GEO (WGS84) geocentric speherical coords. (r, theta, phi)  theta is colat
01338      */
01339     r     = sqrt(w.x*w.x + w.y*w.y + w.z*w.z ); 
01340     theta = acos( w.z / r );
01341     phi   = atan2(w.y, w.x);
01342 
01343 
01344     st    = sin( theta ); ct    = cos( theta );
01345     sp    = sin( phi );   cp    = cos( phi );
01346 
01347 
01348     /*
01349      *   Compute spherical components of B in GEO (WGS84)
01350      */
01351     w.x = r; w.y = theta; w.z = phi;
01352     Lgm_IGRF( &w, &Bgeo, c );
01353     B_r = Bgeo.x; B_theta = Bgeo.y; B_phi = Bgeo.z;
01354 
01355 
01356 
01357     /*
01358      *  Convert Bgeo to cartesian
01359      */
01360     Bgeo.x = B_r*st*cp + B_theta*ct*cp - B_phi*sp;
01361     Bgeo.y = B_r*st*sp + B_theta*ct*sp + B_phi*cp;
01362     Bgeo.z = B_r*ct    - B_theta*st;
01363 
01364     /*
01365      *  Convert Coords to GSM
01366      */
01367     Lgm_Convert_Coords( &Bgeo, B, WGS84_TO_GSM, c );
01368 
01369 
01370 }
01371 
01372 
01373 
01374 void Lgm_B_cdip_ctrans(Lgm_Vector *v, Lgm_Vector *B, Lgm_CTrans *c) {
01375 
01376     double  x_sm, y_sm, z_sm;
01377     double  rho, theta, phi;
01378     Lgm_Vector  Bsm;
01379     double  B_rho, B_theta, B_phi;
01380     double  M, rho2, rho3;
01381     double  cp, sp, ct, st;
01382 
01383     M = c->M_cd;
01384 
01385     /* 
01386      *  compute SM coords from GSM coords 
01387      */
01388     x_sm = v->x*c->cos_psi - v->z*c->sin_psi;
01389     y_sm = v->y;
01390     z_sm = v->x*c->sin_psi + v->z*c->cos_psi;
01391 
01392 
01393     /* 
01394      *  convert x_sm, y_sm, and, z_sm to spherical coords. 
01395      */
01396     rho   = sqrt(x_sm*x_sm + y_sm*y_sm + z_sm*z_sm);
01397     phi   = atan2(y_sm, x_sm);
01398     theta = acos(z_sm / rho);
01399 
01400 
01401     /* 
01402      *  compute centered dipole field in spherical coords
01403      *  i.e. (B_rho, B_theta, B_phi) 
01404      */
01405     rho2     = rho*rho;
01406     rho3     = rho*rho2;
01407     cp       = cos( phi );
01408     sp       = sin( phi );
01409     ct       = cos( theta );
01410     st       = sin( theta );
01411     B_rho    = -2.0*M*ct/rho3;
01412     B_phi    =  0.0;
01413     B_theta  = -1.0*M*st/rho3;
01414 
01415 
01416     /* 
01417      *   Transform (B_rho, B_theta, B_phi) -> (B_xsm, B_ysm, B_zsm)  (still SM)
01418      */
01419     Bsm.x = B_rho*st*cp + B_theta*ct*cp;
01420     Bsm.y = B_rho*st*sp + B_theta*ct*sp;
01421     Bsm.z = B_rho*ct    - B_theta*st;
01422                                                                                                                                                                              
01423 
01424     /* 
01425      *  Transform (B_xsm, B_ysm, B_zsm) -> (B_x, B_y, B_z) i.e. trans. to GSM 
01426      */
01427     B->x =  Bsm.x*c->cos_psi + Bsm.z*c->sin_psi;
01428     B->y =  Bsm.y;
01429     B->z = -Bsm.x*c->sin_psi + Bsm.z*c->cos_psi;
01430 
01431 
01432 }
01433 
01434 
01435 void Lgm_B_edip_ctrans(Lgm_Vector *v, Lgm_Vector *B, Lgm_CTrans *c) {
01436 
01437     double  x_sm, y_sm, z_sm;
01438     double  x_ed, y_ed, z_ed;
01439     double  rho, theta, phi;
01440     Lgm_Vector  Bsm;
01441     double  B_rho, B_theta, B_phi;
01442     double  M, rho2, rho3;
01443     double  cp, sp, ct, st;
01444 
01445     M = c->M_cd;
01446 
01447     /* 
01448      *  compute SM coords from GSM coords 
01449      */
01450     x_sm = v->x*c->cos_psi - v->z*c->sin_psi;
01451     y_sm = v->y;
01452     z_sm = v->x*c->sin_psi + v->z*c->cos_psi;
01453 
01454 
01455     /* 
01456      *  compute ED coords from SM coords  (i.e. offset the dipole)
01457      */
01458     x_ed = x_sm - c->ED_x0;
01459     y_ed = y_sm - c->ED_y0;
01460     z_ed = z_sm - c->ED_z0;
01461 
01462 
01463     /* 
01464      *  convert to spherical coords. 
01465      */
01466     rho   = sqrt(x_ed*x_ed + y_ed*y_ed + z_ed*z_ed);
01467     phi   = atan2(y_ed, x_ed);
01468     theta = acos(z_ed / rho);
01469 
01470 
01471     /* 
01472      *  compute centered dipole field in spherical coords
01473      *  i.e. (B_rho, B_theta, B_phi) 
01474      */
01475     rho2     = rho*rho;
01476     rho3     = rho*rho2;
01477     cp       = cos( phi );
01478     sp       = sin( phi );
01479     ct       = cos( theta );
01480     st       = sin( theta );
01481     B_rho    = -2.0*M*ct/rho3;
01482     B_phi    =  0.0;
01483     B_theta  = -1.0*M*st/rho3;
01484 
01485 
01486     /* 
01487      *   Transform (B_rho, B_theta, B_phi) -> (B_xsm, B_ysm, B_zsm)  (still SM)
01488      */
01489     Bsm.x = B_rho*st*cp + B_theta*ct*cp;
01490     Bsm.y = B_rho*st*sp + B_theta*ct*sp;
01491     Bsm.z = B_rho*ct    - B_theta*st;
01492                                                                                                                                                                              
01493 
01494     /* 
01495      *  Transform (B_xsm, B_ysm, B_zsm) -> (B_x, B_y, B_z) i.e. trans. to GSM 
01496      */
01497     B->x =  Bsm.x*c->cos_psi + Bsm.z*c->sin_psi;
01498     B->y =  Bsm.y;
01499     B->z = -Bsm.x*c->sin_psi + Bsm.z*c->cos_psi;
01500 
01501 
01502 }
01503 
01504 
01505 /*
01506  *  Compute the Julian Day number for the given date.
01507  *  Julian Date is the number of days since noon of Jan 1 4713 B.C.
01508  */
01509 void Lgm_jd_to_ymdh ( double JD, long int *Date, int *year, int *month, int *day, double *UT ) {
01510 
01511     int     I, A, B, C, D, E, y, G;
01512     double  F, m, d;
01513 
01514 
01515     JD += 0.5;
01516     I = (int)JD;
01517     F = JD - (double)I;
01518 
01519     if ( I > 2299160 ) {
01520         A = (int)( ((double)I-1867216.25)/36524.25 );
01521         B = I + 1 + A - (int)( A/4 );
01522     } else {
01523         B = I;
01524     }
01525 
01526     C = B + 1524;
01527     D = (int)( ((double)C - 122.1)/365.25 );
01528     E = (int)( 365.25 * D );
01529     G = (int)( (double)((C-E))/30.6001 );
01530     d = (double)(C - E) + F - (double)( (int)( 30.6001*G ) );
01531 
01532     if ( (double)G < 13.5 ) {
01533         m = (double)G - 1.0;
01534     } else {
01535         m = (double)G - 13.0;
01536     }
01537     if ( m > 2.5 ) {
01538         y = D - 4716;
01539     } else {
01540         y = D - 4715;
01541     }
01542 
01543     *day = (int)d;
01544     *UT  = (d - *day)*24.0;
01545     *month = (int)m;
01546     *year = y;
01547     *Date = *year*10000 + *month*100 + *day;
01548 }
01549 
01550 //?
01551 void Lgm_mjd_to_ymdh( double MJD, long int *Date, int *year, int *month, int *day, double *UT ) {
01552     Lgm_mjd_to_ymdh( MJD+2400000.5, Date, year, month, day, UT );
01553 }
01554 
01555 
01556 
01557 /*
01558  * milli-seconds are rounded up to nearest whole milli-second
01559  */
01560 void Lgm_UT_to_hmsms( double UT, int *Hour, int *Min, int *Sec, int *MilliSec ) {
01561 
01562     *Hour = (int)UT; UT = (UT - *Hour)*60.0;
01563     *Min  = (int)UT; UT = (UT - *Min)*60.0;
01564     *Sec  = (int)UT; UT = (UT - *Sec)*1000.0;
01565     *MilliSec = (int)(UT+0.5);
01566 
01567     if (*MilliSec == 1000) {
01568         *MilliSec -= 1000;
01569         *Sec += 1;
01570     }
01571 
01572     if (*Sec == 60) {
01573         *Sec = *Sec-60;
01574         *Min += 1;
01575     }
01576 
01577     if ( *Min == 60 ) {
01578         *Min -= 60.0;
01579         *Hour += 1;
01580     }
01581 }
01582 
01583 
01584 /*
01585  * seconds are rounded up to nearest whole second
01586  */
01587 void Lgm_UT_to_HMS( double UT, int *HH, int *MM, int *SS ) {
01588 
01589     int     Days, Hours, Minutes;
01590     double  Seconds;
01591 
01592     Seconds = UT*3600.0;
01593 
01594     Days     = (int)(Seconds/86400.0);
01595     Seconds -= Days*86400.0;
01596 
01597     Hours    = (int)(Seconds/3600.0);
01598     Seconds -= Hours*3600.0;
01599 
01600     Minutes  = (int)(Seconds/60.0);
01601     Seconds -= Minutes*60.0;
01602 
01603     *HH = Hours;
01604     *MM = Minutes;
01605     *SS = (int)(Seconds+0.5);
01606 
01607 }
01608 
01609 void Lgm_UT_to_HMSd( double UT, int *sgn, int *HH, int *MM, double *SS ) {
01610 
01611     int     Days, Hours, Minutes;
01612     double  Seconds;
01613 
01614     *sgn = (UT < 0.0) ? -1 : 1;
01615     UT = fabs(UT);
01616 
01617     Seconds = UT*3600.0;
01618 
01619     Days     = (int)(Seconds/86400.0);
01620     Seconds -= Days*86400.0;
01621 
01622     Hours    = (int)(Seconds/3600.0);
01623     Seconds -= Hours*3600.0;
01624 
01625     Minutes  = (int)(Seconds/60.0);
01626     Seconds -= Minutes*60.0;
01627 //printf("Hours, Minutes, Seconds = %d %d %lf\n", Hours, Minutes, Seconds);
01628 
01629     if ( Seconds >= 60.0 ) {
01630         Seconds = 0.0;
01631         Minutes += 1;
01632     }
01633     if ( Minutes >= 60.0 ) {
01634         Minutes = 0;
01635         Hours += 1;
01636     }
01637 
01638     *HH = Hours;
01639     *MM = Minutes;
01640     *SS = Seconds;
01641 //printf("Hours, Minutes, Seconds = %d %d %lf\n", Hours, Minutes, Seconds);
01642 
01643 }
01644 
01645 void Lgm_D_to_DMS( double D, int *DD, int *MM, int *SS ) {
01646 
01647     int     sgn;
01648     double  f;
01649 
01650     sgn = (D < 0.0) ? -1 : 1;
01651     D = fabs(D);
01652 
01653     *DD = (int)D; // degrees
01654 
01655     f = (D - (double)*DD)*60.0;  // decimal minutes
01656     *MM = (int)f;               // number of whole minutes
01657 
01658     f = (f - (double)*MM)*60.0; // decimal seconds
01659     *SS = (int)(f+0.5);
01660 
01661     if ( *SS == 60 ){
01662         *SS = 0;
01663         ++(*MM);
01664     }
01665 
01666     if ( *MM == 60 ){
01667         *MM = 0;
01668         ++(*DD);
01669     }
01670     
01671     
01672 
01673 
01674     *DD *= sgn;   // put sign back onto whole degrees part only
01675 
01676 }
01677 
01678 
01679 // return a decimal degree broken down int whole degrees, whole arc-minutes and
01680 // decimal arc-seconds. Also return the sign of the original number.
01681 void Lgm_D_to_DMSd( double D, int *sgn, int *DD, int *MM, double *SS ) {
01682 
01683     double  f;
01684 
01685     *sgn = (D < 0.0) ? -1 : 1;
01686     D = fabs(D);
01687 
01688     *DD = (int)D; // degrees
01689 
01690     f = (D - (double)*DD)*60.0;  // decimal minutes
01691     *MM = (int)f;               // number of whole minutes
01692 
01693     f = (f - (double)*MM)*60.0; // decimal seconds
01694     *SS = f;
01695 
01696 }
01697 
01698 
01699 double Lgm_GetCurrentJD( Lgm_CTrans *c ){
01700 
01701     time_t      CurrentTime;
01702     struct tm   tp;
01703     double      UTC, JD;
01704 
01705 
01706     CurrentTime = time( NULL );
01707     gmtime_r( &CurrentTime, &tp );
01708     UTC   = (double)(tp.tm_hour + tp.tm_min/60.0 +  tp.tm_sec/3600.0);
01709     JD   = Lgm_JD( tp.tm_year+1900, tp.tm_mon+1, tp.tm_mday, UTC, LGM_TIME_SYS_UTC, c );
01710 
01711     return( JD );
01712 
01713 }
01714 
01715 double Lgm_GetCurrentMJD( Lgm_CTrans *c ){
01716     return( Lgm_GetCurrentJD( c ) - 2400000.5 );
01717 }

01719 
01720 // types out hours/minutes/seconds with unicode characters.
01721 void Lgm_Print_HMS( double d ){
01722     int HH, MM, SS;
01723     Lgm_UT_to_HMS( d, &HH, &MM, &SS );
01724     printf("%02d\u02b0 %02d\u1d50 %02d\u02e2", HH, MM, SS);
01725 }
01726 /*
01727  * This routine prints out time in different ways.
01728  *
01729  * int UnicodeHMS  -- Input
01730  *                    Controls the style of printing. If TRUE it
01731  *                    prints with h, m, s as superscripts.
01732  *                    Othwewise it prints with colons.
01733  * int p           -- Input
01734  *                    Controls how many decimals to print for the seconds.
01735  *                    Max of 20 (-- although prob more than machine prec.)
01736  */
01737 void Lgm_Print_HMSdp( double d, int UnicodeHMS, int p ){
01738     int         HH, MM, SS, sgn;
01739     double      S, SFRAC;
01740     char        SecFracStr[30];
01741 
01742 
01743     Lgm_UT_to_HMSd( d, &sgn, &HH, &MM, &S );
01744 
01745 //printf("HH, MM, S = %d %d %.20lf\n", HH, MM, S);
01746     S     = fabs(S)+pow(10.0, -1.0-p );
01747     SS    = (int)S;
01748     SFRAC = S-(double)SS;
01749 //printf("HH, MM, S = %d %d %.20lf\n", HH, MM, S);
01750 
01751 
01752 //printf("S = %lf SFRAC = %lf\n", S, SFRAC);
01753     if (( p <= 0 ) && ( SFRAC >= 0.5)) { SS += 1; }
01754 
01755 //printf("S = %lf\n", S);
01756 
01757     sprintf( SecFracStr, "%.*lf", (p>=20)?20:p, SFRAC );
01758     if (SS==60)  { SS=0; ++MM; }
01759     if (MM==60)  { MM=0; ++HH; }
01760 
01761 
01762     // probably a cleaner way to do this(?)
01763     if ( p <= 0 ) {
01764         if ( UnicodeHMS ) {
01765             if (sgn<0) printf("-%02d\u02b0 %02d\u1d50 %02d\u02e2", HH, MM, SS );
01766             else       printf(" %02d\u02b0 %02d\u1d50 %02d\u02e2", HH, MM, SS );
01767         } else {
01768             if (sgn<0) printf("-%02d:%02d:%02d", HH, MM, SS );
01769             else       printf(" %02d:%02d:%02d", HH, MM, SS );
01770         }
01771     } else {
01772         if ( UnicodeHMS ) {
01773             if (sgn<0) printf("-%02d\u02b0 %02d\u1d50 %02d\u02e2.%s", HH, MM, SS, strstr(SecFracStr, ".")+1 );
01774             else       printf(" %02d\u02b0 %02d\u1d50 %02d\u02e2.%s", HH, MM, SS, strstr(SecFracStr, ".")+1 );
01775         } else {
01776             if (sgn<0) printf("-%02d:%02d:%02d.%s", HH, MM, SS, strstr(SecFracStr, ".")+1 );
01777             else       printf(" %02d:%02d:%02d.%s", HH, MM, SS, strstr(SecFracStr, ".")+1 );
01778         }
01779     }
01780 
01781 }
01782 
01783 
01784 // types out hours/minutes/seconds with unicode characters.
01785 // does decimals on the seconds
01786 void Lgm_Print_HMSd( double d ){
01787     int HH, MM, SS, MS, sgn;
01788     double S;
01789     Lgm_UT_to_HMSd( d, &sgn, &HH, &MM, &S );
01790     S = fabs(S);
01791     SS = (int)S;
01792     MS = (int)((S-(double)SS)*1000.0+0.5);
01793     if (MS==1000){ MS=0; ++SS; }
01794     if (SS==60)  { SS=0; ++MM; }
01795     if (MM==60)  { MM=0; ++HH; }
01796     if (sgn<0) printf("-%02d\u02b0 %02d\u1d50 %02d\u02e2.%03d", HH, MM, SS, MS);
01797     else       printf(" %02d\u02b0 %02d\u1d50 %02d\u02e2.%03d", HH, MM, SS, MS);
01798     
01799 }
01800 
01801 // types out degrees/arc-minutes/arc-seconds with unicode characters.
01802 void Lgm_Print_DMS( double d ){
01803     int HH, MM, SS;
01804     Lgm_D_to_DMS( d, &HH, &MM, &SS );
01805     printf("%02d\u00b0 %02d\u2032 %02d\u2033", HH, MM, SS);
01806 }
01807 
01808 // types out degrees/arc-minutes/arc-seconds with unicode characters.
01809 // does decimals on the arc-seconds
01810 void Lgm_Print_DMSd( double d ){
01811     int DD, MM, SS, MS, sgn;
01812     double S;
01813     Lgm_D_to_DMSd( d, &sgn, &DD, &MM, &S );
01814     SS = (int)S;
01815     MS = (int)((S-(double)SS)*1000.0+0.5);
01816     if (MS==1000){ MS=0; ++SS; }
01817     if (SS==60)  { SS=0; ++MM; }
01818     if (MM==60)  { MM=0; ++DD; }
01819 
01820     if ( sgn < 0 ) printf("-%02d\u00b0 %02d\u2032 %02d\u2033.%03d", DD, MM, SS, MS);
01821     else           printf(" %02d\u00b0 %02d\u2032 %02d\u2033.%03d", DD, MM, SS, MS);
01822 }
01823 
01824 /*
01825  *  Given Cartesian CDMAG vector, convert to R, MLAT, MLON, MLT
01826  */
01827 void Lgm_CDMAG_to_R_MLAT_MLON_MLT( Lgm_Vector *u, double *R, double *MLAT, double *MLON, double *MLT, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
01828 
01829     double      SunMlon;
01830     Lgm_Vector  v, w;
01831 
01832     // Get R and MLAT
01833     w     = *u; // copy vector -- so we dont normalize original
01834     *R    = Lgm_NormalizeVector( &w );
01835     *MLAT = asin( u->z/(*R) )*DegPerRad;
01836     
01837     // Find Longitude of Sun vector in CDMAG coords.
01838     // And the Long thats 180deg. from it. (Because thats what MLT is reckoned from).
01839     Lgm_Convert_Coords( &(c->Sun), &v, MOD_TO_CDMAG, c );
01840     SunMlon = atan2( v.y, v.x )*DegPerRad; // in range -180 to 180
01841     SunMlon += 180.0; // in range 0 to 360
01842     
01843     // Find Longitude of input vector in CDMAG coords.
01844     *MLON = atan2( u->y, u->x )*DegPerRad; // in range -180 to 180
01845     if (*MLON < 0.0)  *MLON += 360.0;       // puts into range 0 to 360
01846 
01847     // Compute MLT (add 24 before the fmod so we dont get negative).
01848     *MLT = fmod( (*MLON-SunMlon)/15.0+24.0, 24.0 );
01849 
01850 }
01851 
01852 
01853 /*
01854  * returns cartesian vector in CDMAG coords. 
01855  *  MLT in decimal hours.
01856  *  MLON in degrees.
01857  *  MLAT in degrees.
01858  *  R in Re
01859  *  
01860  */
01861 void Lgm_R_MLAT_MLT_to_CDMAG( double R, double MLAT, double MLT, Lgm_Vector *u, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
01862 
01863     Lgm_Vector  v;
01864     double  Mlon, SunMlon, phi, the, ct;
01865 
01866     // Find Longitude of Sun vector in CDMAG coords.
01867     // And the Long thats 180deg. from it. (Because thats what MLT is reckoned from).
01868     Lgm_Convert_Coords( &(c->Sun), &v, MOD_TO_CDMAG, c );
01869     SunMlon = atan2( v.y, v.x )*DegPerRad; // in range -180 to 180
01870     SunMlon += 180.0; // in range 0 to 360
01871 
01872     Mlon = (MLT*15.0 + SunMlon);
01873     phi = Mlon * RadPerDeg;
01874     the = MLAT*RadPerDeg;
01875     ct  = cos( the );
01876    
01877 
01878     u->x = R*cos( phi )*ct;
01879     u->y = R*sin( phi )*ct;
01880     u->z = R*sin( the );
01881 
01882 }
01883 
01884 
01885 
01886 /*
01887  *  Given Cartesian EDMAG vector, convert to R, MLAT, MLON, MLT
01888  */
01889 void Lgm_EDMAG_to_R_MLAT_MLON_MLT( Lgm_Vector *u, double *R, double *MLAT, double *MLON, double *MLT, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
01890 
01891     double      SunMlon;
01892     Lgm_Vector  v, w;
01893 
01894     // Get R and MLAT
01895     w     = *u; // copy vector -- so we dont normalize original
01896     *R    = Lgm_NormalizeVector( &w );
01897     *MLAT = asin( u->z/(*R) )*DegPerRad;
01898     
01899     // Find Longitude of Sun vector in CDMAG coords.
01900     // And the Long thats 180deg. from it. (Because thats what MLT is reckoned from).
01901     Lgm_Convert_Coords( &(c->Sun), &v, MOD_TO_EDMAG, c );
01902     SunMlon = atan2( v.y, v.x )*DegPerRad; // in range -180 to 180
01903     SunMlon += 180.0; // in range 0 to 360
01904     
01905     // Find Longitude of input vector in CDMAG coords.
01906     *MLON = atan2( u->y, u->x )*DegPerRad; // in range -180 to 180
01907     if (*MLON < 0.0)  *MLON += 360.0;       // puts into range 0 to 360
01908 
01909     // Compute MLT (add 24 before the fmod so we dont get negative).
01910     *MLT = fmod( (*MLON-SunMlon)/15.0+24.0, 24.0 );
01911 
01912 }
01913 
01914 /*
01915  * returns cartesian vector in EDMAG coords. 
01916  *      R in Re.
01917  *      MLAT in degrees.
01918  *      MLT in decimal hours.
01919  */
01920 void Lgm_R_MLAT_MLT_to_EDMAG( double R, double MLAT, double MLT, Lgm_Vector *u, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
01921 
01922     Lgm_Vector  v;
01923     double  Mlon, SunMlon, phi, the, ct;
01924 
01925     // Find Longitude of Sun vector in CDMAG coords.
01926     // And the Long thats 180deg. from it. (Because thats what MLT is reckoned from).
01927     Lgm_Convert_Coords( &(c->Sun), &v, MOD_TO_EDMAG, c );
01928     SunMlon = atan2( v.y, v.x )*DegPerRad; // in range -180 to 180
01929     SunMlon += 180.0; // in range 0 to 360
01930 
01931     Mlon = (MLT*15.0 + SunMlon);
01932     phi = Mlon * RadPerDeg;
01933     the = MLAT*RadPerDeg;
01934     ct  = cos( the );
01935    
01936 
01937     u->x = R*cos( phi )*ct;
01938     u->y = R*sin( phi )*ct;
01939     u->z = R*sin( the );
01940 
01941 }

01944 
01945 /*
01946  *  Convert GLAT/GLON to CDMAG MLAT/MLON/MLT
01947  */
01948 void Lgm_GLATLON_TO_CDMLATLONMLT( double GLAT, double GLON, double *MLAT, double *MLON, double *MLT, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
01949 
01950     Lgm_Vector  v, w, z;
01951     double  Mlon, SunMlon, phi, the, ct;
01952 
01953     // Find Longitude of Sun vector in CDMAG coords.
01954     // And the Long thats 180deg. from it. (Because thats what MLT is reckoned from).
01955     Lgm_Convert_Coords( &(c->Sun), &v, MOD_TO_CDMAG, c );
01956     SunMlon = atan2( v.y, v.x )*DegPerRad; // in range -180 to 180
01957     SunMlon += 180.0; // in range 0 to 360
01958 
01959     // Convert GLAT/GLON to cartesian (assume r==1)
01960     phi = GLON*RadPerDeg;
01961     the = GLAT*RadPerDeg;
01962     ct  = cos(the);
01963     w.x = cos( phi )*ct;
01964     w.y = sin( phi )*ct;
01965     w.z = sin( the );
01966 
01967     // Convert to CDMAG
01968     Lgm_Convert_Coords( &w, &z, WGS84_TO_CDMAG, c );
01969     *MLAT = asin( z.z )*DegPerRad;
01970     *MLON = atan2( z.y, z.x )*DegPerRad;
01971     if (*MLON < 0.0)  *MLON += 360.0;       // puts into range 0 to 360
01972 
01973     // Compute MLT (add 24 before the fmod so we dont get negative).
01974     *MLT = fmod( (*MLON-SunMlon)/15.0+24.0, 24.0 );
01975 
01976 }
01977 
01978 /*
01979  *  Convert GLAT/GLON to EDMAG MLAT/MLON/MLT
01980  */
01981 void Lgm_GLATLON_TO_EDMLATLONMLT( double GLAT, double GLON, double *MLAT, double *MLON, double *MLT, Lgm_CTrans *c ) {
01982

01984     double  Mlon, SunMlon, phi, the, ct;

01986     // Find Longitude of Sun vector in CDMAG coords.
01987     // And the Long thats 180deg. from it. (Because thats what MLT is reckoned from).
01988     Lgm_Convert_Coords( &(c->Sun), &v, MOD_TO_EDMAG, c );
01989     SunMlon = atan2( v.y, v.x )*DegPerRad; // in range -180 to 180
01990     SunMlon += 180.0; // in range 0 to 360
01991 
01992     // Convert GLAT/GLON to cartesian (assume r==1)
01993     phi = GLON*RadPerDeg;
01994     the = GLAT*RadPerDeg;
01995     ct  = cos(the);
01996     w.x = cos( phi )*ct;
01997     w.y = sin( phi )*ct;
01998     w.z = sin( the );
01999 
02000     // Convert to CDMAG
02001     Lgm_Convert_Coords( &w, &z, WGS84_TO_EDMAG, c );
02002     *MLAT = asin( z.z )*DegPerRad;
02003     *MLON = atan2( z.y, z.x )*DegPerRad;
02004     if (*MLON < 0.0)  *MLON += 360.0;       // puts into range 0 to 360
02005 
02006     // Compute MLT (add 24 before the fmod so we dont get negative).
02007     *MLT = fmod( (*MLON-SunMlon)/15.0+24.0, 24.0 );
02008 
02009 }

02012 void ParseTimeStr( char *Str, int *Year, int *Month, int *Day, int *hh, int *mm, double *ss, long int *Date, double *H ) {
02013     char *p = (char *)malloc(10);
02014     sscanf( Str, "%4d %3s %d %2d:%2d:%lf", Year, p, Day, hh, mm, ss );
02015     *Month = MonthStrToNum( p );
02016 //printf("Year, p, Day, hh, mm, ss = %d %d %d %d %d %lf\n", *Year, *Month, *Day, *hh, *mm, *ss );
02017     free(p);
02018     *Date = *Year*10000+ *Month*100 + *Day;
02019     *H    = (double)*hh + (double)*mm/60.0 + *ss/3600.0;
02020 }
02021 
02022 
02023 int MonthStrToNum( char *str ) {
02024     char *p = Lgm_StrToLower( str, strlen(str) ); // force to lower case
02025     if      ( !strncmp( p, "jan", 3 ) ) { return(  1 ); }
02026     else if ( !strncmp( p, "feb", 3 ) ) { return(  2 ); }
02027     else if ( !strncmp( p, "mar", 3 ) ) { return(  3 ); }
02028     else if ( !strncmp( p, "apr", 3 ) ) { return(  4 ); }
02029     else if ( !strncmp( p, "may", 3 ) ) { return(  5 ); }
02030     else if ( !strncmp( p, "jun", 3 ) ) { return(  6 ); }
02031     else if ( !strncmp( p, "jul", 3 ) ) { return(  7 ); }
02032     else if ( !strncmp( p, "aug", 3 ) ) { return(  8 ); }
02033     else if ( !strncmp( p, "sep", 3 ) ) { return(  9 ); }
02034     else if ( !strncmp( p, "oct", 3 ) ) { return( 10 ); }
02035     else if ( !strncmp( p, "nov", 3 ) ) { return( 11 ); }
02036     else if ( !strncmp( p, "dec", 3 ) ) { return( 12 ); }
02037     else                                { return( LGM_ERROR ); }
02038 }
02039 
02040 
02041 char *Lgm_StrToLower( char *str, int nmax ) {
02042     int  n = 0;
02043     char *p = str;
02044     while ( (p != '\0' ) && (n<nmax) ){ 
02045         *p = (unsigned char)tolower(*p); 
02046         ++p; 
02047         ++n; 
02048     }
02049     return( str );
02050 }
02051 
02052 char *Lgm_StrToUpper( char *str, int nmax ) {
02053     int  n = 0;
02054     char *p = str;
02055     while ( (p != '\0' ) && (n<nmax) ){ 
02056         *p = (unsigned char)toupper(*p); 
02057         ++p; 
02058         ++n; 
02059     }
02060     return( str );
02061 }
